datasetStructure: One record per body system or abnormality per visit per subject

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.

datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PE.PESEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: PESEQ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PE.PEGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Used to link together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
datasetVariables.label: Group ID
datasetVariables.name: PEGRPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PE.PESPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Perhaps preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a CRF.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariables.name: PESPID

modelClassVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PE.PETESTCD

datasetVariables.description: Short name of a part of the body examined in a physical examination. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in PETESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). PETESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "HEAD", "ENT". If the results of the entire physical examination are represented in one record, value should be "PHYSEXAM".
datasetVariables.label: Body System Examined Short Name
datasetVariables.name: PETESTCD

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PE.PETEST

datasetVariables.description: Long name of a part of the body examined in a physical examination. The value in PETEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Head", "Ear/Nose/Throat". If the results of the entire physical examination are represented in one record, value should be "Physical Examination".
datasetVariables.label: Body System Examined
datasetVariables.name: PETEST

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PE.PEMODIFY

datasetVariables.description: If the value of PEORRES is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.
datasetVariables.label: Modified Reported Term
datasetVariables.name: PEMODIFY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PE.PECAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Examples: "GENERAL".
datasetVariables.label: Category for Examination
datasetVariables.name: PECAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PE.PESCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to define a further categorization of --CAT values.
datasetVariables.label: Subcategory for Examination
datasetVariables.name: PESCAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PE.PEBODSYS

datasetVariables.description: Body system or organ class (MedDRA SOC) that is involved for a finding from the standard hierarchy for dictionary-coded results (e.g., MedDRA).
datasetVariables.label: Body System or Organ Class
datasetVariables.name: PEBODSYS

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PE.PEORRES

datasetVariables.description: Text description of any abnormal findings. If the examination was completed and there were no abnormal findings, the value should be "NORMAL". If the examination was not performed on a particular body system, or at the subject level, then the value should be null, and "NOT DONE" should appear in PESTAT.
datasetVariables.label: Verbatim Examination Finding
datasetVariables.name: PEORRES

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PE.PEORRESU

datasetVariables.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for PEORRES.
datasetVariables.label: Original Units
datasetVariables.name: PEORRESU

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PE.PESTRESC

datasetVariables.description: If there are findings for a body system, then either the dictionary preferred term (if findings are coded using a dictionary) or PEORRES (if findings are not encoded) should appear here. If PEORRES is null, PESTRESC must be null.
datasetVariables.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
datasetVariables.name: PESTRESC

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PE.PESTAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate exam not done. Must be null if a result exists in PEORRES/PESTRESC.
datasetVariables.label: Completion Status
datasetVariables.name: PESTAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PE.PEREASND

datasetVariables.description: Describes why an examination was not performed or why a body system was not examined. Example: "SUBJECT REFUSED". Used in conjunction with PESTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
datasetVariables.label: Reason Not Examined
datasetVariables.name: PEREASND

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PE.PELOC

datasetVariables.description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Example: "ARM" for skin rash.
datasetVariables.label: Location of Physical Exam Finding
datasetVariables.name: PELOC

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PE.PELAT

datasetVariables.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterallity. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".
datasetVariables.label: Laterality
datasetVariables.name: PELAT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C85492

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PE.PEMETHOD

datasetVariables.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "PALPATION", "PERCUSSION".
datasetVariables.label: Method of Test or Examination
datasetVariables.name: PEMETHOD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PE.PELOBXFL

datasetVariables.description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. Should be "Y" or null.
datasetVariables.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
datasetVariables.name: PELOBXFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PE.PEBLFL

datasetVariables.description: A baseline defined by the sponsor (could be derived in the same manner as PELOBXFL or ABLFL, but is not required to be). The value should be "Y" or null. Note that PEBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
datasetVariables.label: Baseline Flag
datasetVariables.name: PEBLFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PE.PEEVAL

datasetVariables.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Example: "INVESTIGATOR".
datasetVariables.label: Evaluator
datasetVariables.name: PEEVAL

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

datasetVariables.description:
1. Clinical encounter number.
2. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

datasetVariables.name: VISITNUM

datasetVariables.name: PEDTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PE.PEDY

datasetVariables.description:
1. Study day of physical exam, measured as integer days.
2. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.

datasetVariables.name: PEDY

description: A findings domain that contains findings observed during a physical examination where the body is evaluated by inspection, palpation, percussion, and auscultation. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49608, 2018-06-29)
label: Physical Examination
name: PE
